Customized VPC theme with pmxhelpr default aesthetics

Source: R/plot_vpc_exactbins.R
pmxhelpr_vpc_theme.Rd

Customized VPC theme with pmxhelpr default aesthetics

Usage

pmxhelpr_vpc_theme(update = NULL)

Arguments

update

list containing the plot elements to be updated. Run pmxhelpr_vpc_theme() with no arguments to view defaults.

Value

a listwith vpc theme specifiers

Examples

pmxhelpr_vpc_theme()
#> $obs_color
#> [1] "#0000FF"
#> 
#> $obs_size
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $obs_median_color
#> [1] "#FF0000"
#> 
#> $obs_median_linetype
#> [1] "solid"
#> 
#> $obs_median_size
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $obs_alpha
#> [1] 0.7
#> 
#> $obs_shape
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $obs_ci_color
#> [1] "#0000FF"
#> 
#> $obs_ci_linetype
#> [1] "dashed"
#> 
#> $obs_ci_fill
#> [1] "#80808033"
#> 
#> $obs_ci_size
#> [1] 0.5
#> 
#> $sim_pi_fill
#> [1] "#0000FF"
#> 
#> $sim_pi_alpha
#> [1] 0.15
#> 
#> $sim_pi_color
#> [1] "#000000"
#> 
#> $sim_pi_linetype
#> [1] "dotted"
#> 
#> $sim_pi_size
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $sim_median_fill
#> [1] "#FF0000"
#> 
#> $sim_median_alpha
#> [1] 0.3
#> 
#> $sim_median_color
#> [1] "#000000"
#> 
#> $sim_median_linetype
#> [1] "dashed"
#> 
#> $sim_median_size
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $bin_separators_color
#> [1] "#000000"
#> 
#> $loq_color
#> [1] "#990000"
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "vpc_theme"
new_theme <- pmxhelpr_vpc_theme(update = vpc::new_vpc_theme()) #restores vpc package defaults
